revised_title: Erect Trees with Animal Remains in the Coal Formation of Nova Scotia
tldr: The author discusses the discovery and extraction of erect fossil trees containing animal remains in the coal formation of Nova Scotia. These trees were found in specific horizons in the South Joggins coal field and contained remains of land animals such as Batrachians and Millipedes. The author explains the geological context and the process of extracting and studying these fossils, providing insights into the accumulation and entombment of the animal remains.
